title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1912 play)
text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is a <a href="Broadway%20theatre">Broadway</a> play that debuted at the <a href="Helen%20Hayes%20Theatre">Little Theatre</a> on West 44th Street, New York City, on October 31, 1912. Based on the stories by the <a href="Brothers%20Grimm">Brothers Grimm</a>, it was produced by <a href="Winthrop%20Ames">Winthrop Ames</a> who had written it under the <a href="pseudonym">pseudonym</a> "Jessie Braham White." The play, starring <a href="Marguerite%20Clark">Marguerite Clark</a>, met with favorable reviews and became the basis for the 1916 film "<a href="Snow%20White%20%281916%20film%29">Snow White</a>", also starring Clark.
